Blog.post: The gently rolling grass, crossed and dotted with wildflowers, laid comfortably beneath a crisp blue sky littered with puffy white clouds. A young boy, age five, stood alone in its expanse. His jet-black hair flowed in the light fragrant breeze. His stormy blue eyes and mischievous smile begged for adventure. Yes, this was his kingdom and the ragged brown teddy bear dangling from his left hand was his chief minister. The trees were his guards, the insects and animals his populace, and the Sun a humble advisor who rose early to greet him and bowed out at the end of the day.
